summary: This bill, the 'Geothermal Cost-Recovery Authority Act of 2025,' amends the Geothermal Steam Act of 1970. It grants the Secretary of the Interior temporary authority, until September 30, 2032, to require reimbursement from geothermal lease applicants for the administrative costs of processing applications, permits, and monitoring operations. The Secretary may reduce fees for economic hardship or to promote geothermal use. Collected funds will be used to support the Department of the Interior's geothermal programs. The bill also requires the Secretary to report to Congress within five years on the new authority's impact.
